intro: Roettlera rufipes, commonly known as the red-legged roettlera, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive red stems and yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, adapting to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Roettlera rufipes is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native environment.
